org.apache.river.test.impl.norm

Class TwoArgFiniteOwner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.test.impl.norm.LeaseOwner
      • org.apache.river.test.impl.norm.BaseOwner
        • org.apache.river.test.impl.norm.TwoArgFiniteOwner

  • public class TwoArgFiniteOwner
extends BaseOwner
    BaseOwner for leases who have a finite membership expiration and are added using the two arg form of renewFor

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.river.test.impl.norm.BaseOwner

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoArgFiniteOwner

        public TwoArgFiniteOwner(long initialExpiration,
                         long maxExtension,
                         long desiredExpiration,
                         long slop,
                         Object notifyOnFailure)
        Simple constructor
        Parameters:
        initialExpiration - Initial expiration time for lease.
        maxExtension - Maximum time this owner will be willing to extend the lease
        desiredExpiration - Every lease a renewal service is renewing has a "membership expiration" associated with it. The renewal service should all-ways pick a renewal duration that when added to the current time equals this membership expiration time.
        slop - Allowable variance from desired expiration when making a renewal request.
        notifyOnFailure - Object to notify if there is a failure
